item.title: Communicating Finite State Machines and an Extensible Toolchain for Multiparty Session Types
Communication-Safe Web Programming in TypeScript with Routed Multiparty Session Types
Statically Verified Refinements for Multiparty Protocols
Generating Interactive WebSocket Applications in TypeScript
Statically Verified Refinements for Multiparty Protocols @ OOPSLA '20
item.description: I presented my paper Statically Verified Refinements for Multiparty Protocols at OOPSLA 2020 this year, held virtually. This paper is co-authored by Francisco Ferreira, Raymond Hu, Rumyana Neykova, and Nobuko Yoshida. You can find the paper here from the publisher (Open Access). The full version of the paper is available on arXiv at 2009.06541. The video of the talk is available on YouTube (full version, 15 min), and a short version (5 min) is also available.

item.title: Fluid Session Types @ PLACES
item.description: I gave a talk on the ongoing work of Fluid Session Types last Sunday in PLACES, Prague. This is joint work with my supervisors, Francisco Ferreira, Rumyana Neykova and Nobuko Yoshida. The slides are here. If you feel curious, here is the repo to the ongoing work. It’s still in an embryonic state, but feel free to try out!

item.title: About
item.description: I am a PhD student at Imperial College London, advised by Prof. Nobuko Yoshida. I use they/them pronouns. Some links: Google Scholar DBLP ORCID: 0000-0002-8973-0821
